review: I really enjoy this device.  It works really well with my Ipod touch and Iphone.  I also use it with my chromebook.  I have a DVD player that has youtube built in, but I like searching for youtube clips on my chromebook, it's just easier to type.  It's really easy to control the playback and I like sharing with the family and friends on the TV rather than everyone crowding around a small chrome book screen.  The price is right $35.  Love it.

author: Gadget

review: The chromecast was something of a impulse buy on my part, something I generally am against. However, this time it worked out for me very well.The little device does one thing - stream media from the following applications (on android) to your television via hdmi:NetflixHuluGoogle Play (including Google Music)YouTubeAlso, Chrome for PC can stream a tab to the device (making most webpages possible streaming sources)This list is assured by G to grow over time, something that will be a welcome addition. However, even without that, at this price point its a perfect Netflix box, and the YouTube functionality is excellent. I will be welcoming 3rd party support form Plex et. al., but until that time it still has a very solid selection of media outputs to enjoy.If you need a Netflix box, I would give it a serious consideration. Its a snappy little device that has been very useful around my house.

review: Easy to set up.  Make sure you know your router password before you start the process, though, as you will need to add the Chromecast to your wireless router.  Was a little glitchy and the Chromecast got stuck at 23% while updating.  I unplugged it from the power source and let it reboot.  That seemed to do the trick.  Really nice to watch Netflix on the TV and use my iPhone as a remote.
